docs.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators today warned women taking a prescription anticlotting drug that using certain over-the-counter yeast infection treatments at the same time could cause bruising and bleeding. The Food and Drug Administration urged women being treated with the anticlotting drug, warfarin, to consult their doctors before using the Johnson & Johnson drug Monistat or other vaginal yeast-fighting medications that contain miconazole.

headline.main: National News Briefs; Warning to Women Using Blood-Thinner

docs.abstract: Federal regulators warn women taking warfarin, prescription anticlotting drug, that using certain over-the-counter yeast infection treatments at same time could cause bruising and bleeding (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: There are health books galore for women of every age -- almost. Despite a wealth of books dealing with pregnancy, menopause and virtually every disease, few medical guides deal with the crucial needs of schoolgirls, according to Sharon L. Roan, a medical writer. So Ms. Roan decided to fill the gap. Her informative and inspiring new book, ''Our Daughters' Health: Practical and Invaluable Advice for Raising Confident Girls Ages 6-16,'' is full of practical strategies to make young girls health-conscious.

headline.main: Learning How to Teach Your Daughters Well

docs.abstract: Randi Hutter Epstein reviews Sharon L Roan book Our Daughters' Health: Practical and Invaluable Advice for Raising Confident Girls Ages 6-16; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: When Dr. Robert Fenichel left his emergency medicine job in Arizona to join his future wife in Washington in 1988, he took the first job he found, evaluating new drug applications for the Food and Drug Administration. He did not expect to stay long with the drug agency. ''It seemed in prospect to be sort of Dickensian work, not challenging in any interesting way,'' he said. ''But in fact it is as intellectually demanding as anything I've ever done.''

headline.main: A CONVERSATION WITH/Robert Fenichel; Calculating Safety in Risky World of Drugs

docs.abstract: Interview with Dr Robert Fenichel, who works as consultant for drug companies after working for Food and Drug Administration for 12 years, reviewing applications for new drugs; he discusses risk and benefits weighed in decisions on new drugs, and an abiding truth that many would rather ignore: no drug is without risk; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A Purim Masquerade WEDNESDAY -- The Jewish Museum will give a masked ball at the Waldorf-Astoria, with a Purim play written and performed by Adam Gopnik, the New Yorker magazine staff writer. The evening will raise money for the museum, which offers programs for New York schoolchildren on art, Jewish heritage, culture and immigration. Drinks at 6:30, with dinner, dancing and the performance at 7:30. Black tie or costume. Tickets, $1,000 or $500, for those 35 and younger, from (212) 546-9032.

docs.lead_paragraph: IN Birthright's small storefront office here, pregnant women will sit in quiet consulting rooms and learn what their unborn fetus needs. They may come asking for children's clothes or for adoption counseling or because they aren't sure that they want to have a baby at all. Whatever her situation, each woman will get support for having her child and gentle but firm arguments against having an abortion.
docs.abstract: Birthright, anti-abortion organization which provides free pregnancy tests, housing, day care, clothing, food and adoption advice to mothers-to-be seeking help, opens new, expanded location in Peekskill, NY, with coffee-and-cookies event; photos (M)
